    • Method Detail

      • addCustomInitializer

        public void addCustomInitializer(CustomInitializer customInitializer)
        Description copied from interface: Runtime
        Add an initializer to do custom initializations during startup. The added initializer will be called after the core components were initialized. Initializers which are added after the application was initialized are ignored.
        Specified by:
        addCustomInitializer in interface Runtime
        Parameters:
        customInitializer - the additional initializer

      • addInitializationCompleteListener

        public void addInitializationCompleteListener(InitializationCompleteListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: Runtime
        Add a listener that is informed after the application was completely initialized.
        Specified by:
        addInitializationCompleteListener in interface Runtime
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • addInitializationCondition

        public void addInitializationCondition(String conditionId)
        Description copied from interface: Runtime
        Add a condition which needs to be fulfilled before the application is considered as completely initialized. Adding a condition after the application was initialized has no effect.
        Specified by:
        addInitializationCondition in interface Runtime
        Parameters:
        conditionId - the ID of the condition

      • fulfillInitializationCondition

        public void fulfillInitializationCondition(String conditionId)
        Description copied from interface: Runtime
        Mark a condition that was previously added with Runtime.addInitializationCondition(String) as fulfilled. If this was the last unfulfilled init condition and the core is already initialized the application will be considered as completely initialized and the initialization complete listeners will be called. If the provided condition was not added the call is ignored.
        Specified by:
        fulfillInitializationCondition in interface Runtime
        Parameters:
        conditionId - the ID of the condition to fulfill.

      • getApplicationInformation

        public ApplicationInformation getApplicationInformation()
        Specified by:
        getApplicationInformation in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        information about the running Communote

      • getConfigurationManager

        public ConfigurationManager getConfigurationManager()
        Specified by:
        getConfigurationManager in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        manager for accessing and modifying configuration

      • getInitializationStatus

        public InitializationStatus getInitializationStatus()
        Specified by:
        getInitializationStatus in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        the current status of the initialization

      • getInstaller

        public CommunoteInstaller getInstaller()
        Specified by:
        getInstaller in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        the installer to install Communote or null if Communote is already installed

      • isCoreInitialized

        public boolean isCoreInitialized()
        Specified by:
        isCoreInitialized in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        whether the core application is initialized. This will be true if Communote is installed and the core application with all components is initialized. Some init conditions might not be fulfilled yet.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Specified by:
        isInitialized in interface Runtime
        Returns:
        whether the application is completely initialized. This will be true if Runtime.isCoreInitialized() returns true and all conditions are fulfilled.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the bootstrapping. If the bootstrapping fails a BootstrapException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Runtime

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: Runtime
        Stop the runtime and free any resources held.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Runtime
